Putin and Zelensky appear set for peace summit after fast-moving Trump talks
subhead: Trump said he had spoken by phone on Monday with Putin following a 'very good' meeting with European leaders and the Ukrainian president. German Chancellor Friedrich Merz told reporters at the White House that Putin agreed to meet Zelensky within two weeks. 'We are ready,' Zelensky added to Ukrainian media.
byline: Le Monde with AP and AFP

title: Macron calls for sanctions against Russia if diplomacy fails

In Poland, thousands of young people are spending their 'vacation with the army'
subhead: Launched in 2024, this program drew about 10,000 Poles between the ages of 18 and 35 this summer who, after 27 days of training, have now become reservists in the Polish army.

title: French media coverage of heat waves still has room for improvement
subhead: Although broadcasting media have made clear progress in addressing climate issues since the dramatic summer of 2022, coverage remains insufficient, particularly due to a parallel increase in misinformation.

title: In northeastern France, the third life of a synagogue, transformed into a center of contemporary art
subhead: 'Unusual Places for an Exhibition' (1/6). Le Monde explores six art centers housed in unexpected venues. Today: a former sanctuary that was blown up by the Nazis and rebuilt after the war.

title: AI, my students and me: 'Last semester marks the nadir of my experience in academia'
subhead: 'Letters from America' (1/6). The writer and journalist Thomas Chatterton Williams has been startled by the omnipresence of artificial intelligence at university, which he believes threatens the very foundations of education and our ability to think.

title: The lobo-guará, Brazil's maned wolf, a national icon under threat
subhead: Emblematic of the Cerrado, these animals have seen their habitat fragmented by deforestation and the spread of industrial agriculture. In the state of Minas Gerais, a sanctuary now shelters some of them, aiming to raise public awareness.
byline: By Bruno Meyerfeld (Caraça Sanctuary (Brazil), special correspondent)

title: Climate change: Southern Europe scorched by flames and extreme heat
subhead: The Mediterranean basin is facing a new wave of heatwaves and large-scale wildfires. The affected countries have struggled to cope with the consequences of these extreme events.
byline: By Matthieu Goar, Sandrine Morel (Madrid (Spain) correspondent), Céline Pierre-Magnani (Ankara (Turkey) correspondent) and Marina Rafenberg (Athens (Greece) correspondent)

title: A winemaker, his daughter and a vintage for their undocumented workers
subhead: In southeastern France, Philippe Grisard and his daughter, Nadège, rely daily on undocumented workers to help tend their vineyard. To draw attention to their workers' precarious legal status, they named one of their vintages 'Sans eux' ('Without Them').
